intro: Conophytum gratum, commonly known as the "Cape snowflake," is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, ribbed leaves that store water, allowing it to thrive in arid environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, and yellow during the warmer months. It is typically found in rocky outcrops and sandy soils, where it forms dense clusters. Due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
